reviews.review_msg: Professor Campbell is by far one of my favourite professors at SFU! Not only does he genuinely care about each and everyone of his students, but he also is deeply passionate about that which he teaches. I would wholeheartedly recommend taking courses with Professor Campbell!

Stephen was very insightful and a super nice guy. He made the subject matter very interesting and a lot of what he said stuck with me after the lectures. The weekly quizzes were kind of stressful but other than that the class is very enjoyable.

If you actually want to learn something about math, dont take his class. I feel like I learned more about urban legends than actually understanding how to teach/do math concepts. Very unclear about expectations as well. Just save yourself the trouble and dont take a class with him if you dont have to.

Such a great prof! He is literally the most genuine and kind person ever!! I went into this class having no idea what I was going to learn so I was fairly weary about enrolling. I now can proudly say that I have no regrets! This was such an amazing course and I learned so much from him. He was very accommodating during the pandemic also.

Professor Campbell is extremely understanding, passionate and knowledgeable. Every week you must submit a 200-250 word reflection based on the reading (given to you on Canvas), and complete a quiz. This class is all discussion but you get what you put in and he's very fair. Highly recommend but be prepared to work, read and debate
BEST PROFESSOR EVER. class is very engaging and fun
One of the best profs I've ever take at SFU. Class is mandatory. Really enjoyed the discussions. Thought provoking class.
Amazing prof! He engages with everyone and makes sure to get to know everyone individually! He really makes you open up your mind and think critically. Would definitely recommend!
Great professor. Your learning experience and success is his main interest. Would recommend!
he is amazing ! so friendly and engaging with everyone. He genuinely cares for all his students and do his best to ensure that everyone has a chance to explain themselves.
Great prof. Listening to him for 3 hours can be boring, but the discussions made up for it. GPA Booster
Best Prof. and best class ever!!
Best prof ever

I really enjoyed Sen's class.  Because the math involved in teaching K-8 is so diverse it's hard to touch on everything.  So Sen focused on the idea to convey the interest and excitement of teaching/learning math in order to entice students.  I'm glad this class wasn't just practical things because we already had to cover that in an earlier course

He is AMAZING! His interest for the course is definitely worth taking the course. He is extremely helpful + super kind- always smiling! You need the courseware for sure- there arees every class worth like 30% of your grade. But they're not too difficult as long as you read the course readings every week. Overall, it's easy to excel in this class

His classes were awesome! It sometimes may be boring because he talks to himself for the 3 hour lecture, however, if you listen to what he talks about, sometimes new ideas or thoughts might come to your mind and give you a "click". discussions and quizzes are worth 40% and 30% of your final grade. basically you'll get 40% for your discussion :)

You honestly learn so much in this class- it is totally worth your time. Ya the material may be a bit dry, but you do discussions for majority of the seminar class. Its all about your own opinion.. and in most post secondary classes you don't get to voice your own opinion enough. Best prof ever!!
I am really enjoying the class! Very attractive and interesting topics!
I really enjoyed this class. It was formatted a little differently but if you keep up with the readings you should be fine. Out of the lower div. education classes this was by far my favourite.
I really enjoyed this class. It was formatted a little differently but if you keep up with the readings you should be fine. Out of the lower div. education classes this was by far my favourite.
I really enjoyed this class. It was formatted a little differently but if you keep up with the readings you should be fine. Out of the lower div. education classes this was by far my favourite.
Complete waste of class time. Pretty much talked to himself all class. Wrong Prof for this course but i can see him being a great prof for a Philosophy of Education Class
Amazing Prof. Amazing class! I would take another class that he taught just because he is teaching it! Take this class if you can!!!!!
theorhetical but great...takes nothing for granted...more minds on then hands on

Like the rest of you, I was also enrolled in his math course in hopes of finding ways to better my practice in the classroom. Big mistake. He is completely unable to see the connection between theoretical ideas for teaching elementary and university students. Needless to say, I dropped his course within 2 weeks. Save yourselves.

Let's face it Math can be on of your least favorite courses to teach as an Elem school Teacher. I went into this class hoping to learn something about how to be a better Math Teacher. After Sens class I came out no better off then before.It was the worst class that I have ever taken at SFU.I found his class to be a complete waste of time and money

Brilliant mathematician: maybe. Model for math teaching - nope. It's easy to tell that he's never taught in an elementary classroom.  I improved my own math skills but I'm still struggling as a math teacher.  We needed hands-on instruction with manipulatives, as well as theory, in order for it to stick.  General waste of time and $600.

He is a philosophy teacher not a math teacher. while you can tell he loves the topic he does not help you to become a better math teacher. I think he is a brilliant man with no idea how to teach. The best thing about the class was the textbook

Absolutely the worst course I have ever taken in my six years of University.  Classes were a complete waste of time and there was absolutely no direction provided for individual study.  I took this course to become a better math teacher and I can honestly say that I am no better at teaching math now than before I took this stupid course.

This guy is really nice and means well but is really too brilliant for his own good. If you do not think you are a good math person than avoiud him as you will dwell in the land of the obsscure not practical. His tests are brutal.

He is a great teacher and just a nice guy, overall. He really strives to know everyone and you really enjoy going to class. Everyone participates and it is a class like no other!! Would definately love to be in another of Prof. Campbell's classes!!

I totally recommend this professor. He tries to get to know his students. Marks fairly easily, just wants to know you are thinking about the material. Nice guy.  Can be a bit dry at times though.  But overall good.
No Comments
